comments: This is also the sum of Mod[n+1,k], k=2..Floor[(n+1)/2]. - _Lei Zhou_, Mar 10 2014
links: Lei Zhou, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
mathematica: Table[a = 0; Do[a = a + Mod[n + 1, i], {i, 2, Floor[(n + 1)/2]}]; a, {n, 1, 60}] (* _Lei Zhou_, Mar 10 2014 *)
prog: (Sage)def a(n):                      # _Ralf Stephan_, Mar 14 2014    return sum([(n+1)%k for k in range(2,floor((n+3)/2))])
author: _Clark Kimberling_
